intro: Impatiens roylei var. candida, commonly known as the white impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in partial to full shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
